optionsTitle.message: How to use Vertical Gallery for Notion
optionsTitle.description: The title of the options page.

optionsSubtitle.message: Quick guide to using the extension
optionsSubtitle.description: The subtitle on the options page.

optionsStep1Title.description: Title for the first step in the guide.

optionsStep1Desc.message: Once the extension is installed, navigate to a Notion page containing a gallery with images. Above the gallery, you will see a new switch labeled "Vertical Mode".

optionsStep1Tip.message: The control only appears if the gallery contains at least one image. A page refresh might be necessary.
optionsStep1Tip.description: The content of the tip for step 1.

optionsStep2Title.message: 2. Activate the mode and adjust the height
optionsStep2Title.description: Title for the second step in the guide.

optionsStep2Desc1.message: Click the switch to activate vertical mode. The gallery images will adjust to show their full height.
optionsStep2Desc1.description: First paragraph of the description for step 2.

optionsStep2Desc2.message: Once the mode is activated, + and - buttons will appear, allowing you to fine-tune the height of the images to your liking.
optionsStep2Desc2.description: Second paragraph of the description for step 2.

optionsStep3Title.description: Title for the third step in the guide.

optionsStep3Desc.description: Description for the third step, part before the button name.

optionsHideButtonText.description: The text for the 'Save and hide' button mentioned in the guide.

optionsStep3TipPart1.message: To restore the toggle's visibility, you need to open the extension's popup.
optionsStep3TipPart1.description: First part of the tip for step 3.

optionsStep3TipPart2.message: You can open the popup by clicking the extensions icon in the top right of your browser window, and selecting "Vertical Gallery for Notion".
optionsStep3TipPart2.description: Second part of the tip for step 3.

optionsFooter.message: Thank you for installing Vertical Gallery for Notion!
